intro: Chaetanthera montana, commonly known as mountain chaetanthera, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its fragrant, small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats and is often found in alpine environments. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its roots are used in traditional medicine for their purported therapeutic properties. The species is also noted for its ability to thrive in harsh, high-altitude conditions.
